Posts.EditableText: Does anyone know whether Quest for Windows work for windows server 2008 or windows server 2010?
Posts.HTML: Does anyone know whether Quest for Windows work for windows server 2008 or windows server 2010?

Posts.EditableText: Probably, as those are based on Windows 7 and 8, and Quest works on those (assuming you mean 2012 anyway, there's no 2010 version). It's not something I've tested though.
Posts.HTML: Probably, as those are based on Windows 7 and 8, and Quest works on those (assuming you mean 2012 anyway, there's no 2010 version). It's not something I've tested though.

Posts.EditableText: it's an OS for using your computer as a server (whereas windows home editions of: XP, 7, 8, 10, is for using your computer as a basic client), allowing you to set up domains and etc stuff, via an "Active Directory", to manage the computers connected to it. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Windows_Server_2012 http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/server-c ... r-2012-r2/ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Windows_Server_2008_R2 https://mva.microsoft.com/en-US/trainin ... 6504984382 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Active_Directory A lot of people now (who got the money and technical expertise) have server computers for hosting their own gaming groups~networks. Friends can connect to the person's server computer and play multiplayer online games together, instead of connecting to servers of a game company (such as Blizzard and its servers).
Posts.HTML:
it's an OS for using your computer as a server (whereas windows home editions of: XP, 7, 8, 10, is for using your computer as a basic client), allowing you to set up domains and etc stuff, via an "Active Directory", to manage the computers connected to it.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Windows_Server_2012
http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/server-c ... r-2012-r2/
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Windows_Server_2008_R2
https://mva.microsoft.com/en-US/trainin ... 6504984382
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Active_Directory

A lot of people now (who got the money and technical expertise) have server computers for hosting their own gaming groups~networks. Friends can connect to the person's server computer and play multiplayer online games together, instead of connecting to servers of a game company (such as Blizzard and its servers).

Posts.EditableText:
I've done this mistake too a few times myself... argh...

I'd suggest trying to separate them... as it's really easy to accidentally hit the report button (the symbol~picture looks somewhat similar to the edit button when you're already not paying attention, lol), instead of the edit or comment button (in my case, as I do lots of editing of my posts, and occassional use of the quote button ~ which is when I think I accidentally hit the report button, lol).

having the report button with the other 3 buttons, makes it very easy to accidntally click on it, when you wanted to click on one of the other 3 buttons (the quote button, the delete post button, and the edit button)
